conclusion: Apply principles of static friction and law of moments to solve problem with hemispheres A and B.
Hemispheres A and B have masses m and 2m, positioned with centers inclined at 30° to horizontal.
Identify forces involved; maximum static friction force between hemisphere A and left wall is F_friction = μN.
Normal force N is equal to weight of hemisphere: N = mg.
Maximum static friction force equals sliding friction force: F_friction = μmg.
Friction force F_friction equals normal force N: μmg = mg.
Dynamic friction factor μ is 1, as maximum static friction force equals sliding friction force.
Dynamic friction factor between hemisphere A and left wall is 1.
